title: Adele gushes over Emma Stone's Best Actress win at Oscars | Daily Mail Online
text: comments Adele took to Instagram on Sunday to congratulate her friend Emma Stone on capturing the Best Actress Academy Award. 'Ah Emma,' the 28-year-old wrote in a post accompanied by a shot in which she was standing in front of an enormous TV as Stone, 28, collected her Oscar. The Hello singer also threw her love toward the makers of the film Moonlight, which captured Best Picture amid a controversial flub that saw La La Land accidentally announced as the winner. Happy: Adele, 28, paid homage to her pal Emma Stone, 28, in an Instagram post Monday, after Stone's first Oscar win 'And Moonlight, congratulations so so wonderful,' said Adele, who was named Billboard's Top Artist of the Year for 2016. The English songstress is no stranger to award show gold, as she's captured an eye-popping 15 Grammy Awards over the past five years, including five this month for her efforts for her latest album, 25. Adele - who begins a tour in Australia Tuesday - actually won an Oscar before the La La Land star, grabbing Oscar gold in 2013 for Best Original Song for Skyfall from the James Bond film of the same name. Triumph: The gorgeous Arizona native beamed at a news conference in Hollywood Sunday No stranger to trophies: Adele was snapped earlier this month in LA carrying the five Grammys she won on the night Selfless: Emma called her victory 'a huge confluence of luck and opportunity' in her speech The Someone like You artist and Gangster Squad actress have been chummy in the past, as they were snapped in New York City enjoying a girls night out in November of 2015 with another Oscar-winner, Silver Linings Playbook star Jennifer Lawrence. Stone last night prevailed over fellow nominees Isabelle Huppert, Ruth Negga, Natalie Portman and Meryl Streep for her role as Mia, an acting hopeful, in the Damien Chazelle-directed film. In accepting the film industry's highest honor, Stone said she still has 'a lot of growing and learning and work to do,' with the Oscar statuette functioning as 'a really beautiful symbol to continue on that journey.' Golden girls: Stone, Jennifer Lawrence and Adele - all Oscar winners - were snapped in NYC in November 2015 Stone, who was previously up for a Best Supporting Actress for Birdman in 2015, remained humble in the greatest moment of her career, calling the Academy Award win 'a huge confluence of luck and opportunity.' Meanwhile Adele is making preparations for her first ever Australian tour. She arrived Down Under after winning five Grammys at the recent award show and will visit Brisbane, Sydney, Adelaide and Melbourne for her first tour.
